name: Influence Heat
effect: The mage can guide the direction and/or flow of existing heat. He could, for example, keep warm in cold weather by pulling the ambient warmth shed by other human bodies to himself, or make sure that the dim heat from a radiator on the other side of a bathroom reached the shower stall. He could not increase the temperature of the heat at this level, nor create heat where there is none.

rotes.roteDescription: The mages of the Mysterium like this rote because it allows them to keep their drafty old libraries from losing too much heat.
